How to Install multimedia-drums on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • multimedia-drums

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install multimedia-drums on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing multimedia-drums on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall multimedia-drums in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install multimedia-drums, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install multimedia-drums Using apt

To install multimedia-drums in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install multimedia-drums using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install multimedia-drums

The installation of multimedia-drums might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install multimedia-drums Using apt-get

To install multimedia-drums using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install multimedia-drums.

sudo apt-get -y install multimedia-drums

Install multimedia-drums Using Synaptic

To install multimedia-drums using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install multimedia-drums on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for multimedia-drums. This will display the multimedia-drums package in the package window, now to install multimedia-drums, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the multimedia-drums package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of multimedia-drums.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install multimedia-drums Using aptitude

To install multimedia-drums on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of multimedia-drums.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install multimedia-drums using the command aptitude install multimedia-drums.

sudo aptitude -y install multimedia-drums

How to Upgrade multimedia-drums on debian

If you want to upgrade the multimedia-drums package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade multimedia-drums using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade multimedia-drums to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade multimedia-drums.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade multimedia-drums sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade multimedia-drums

Upgrade multimedia-drums using Aptitude

To upgrade multimedia-drums using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade multimedia-drums.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade multimedia-drums

Upgrade multimedia-drums using Synaptic

To upgrade multimedia-drums using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for multimedia-drums, now right-click multimedia-drums, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade multimedia-drums just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall multimedia-drums on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall multimedia-drums from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just multimedia-drums, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove multimedia-drums

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of multimedia-drums

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of multimedia-drums you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge multimedia-drums

Remove multimedia-drums using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall multimedia-drums using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for multimedia-drums, right-click the multimedia-drums package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall multimedia-drums click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install multimedia-drums on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade multimedia-drums using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of multimedia-drums then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
